meta_description: Where the spirit of art unites us. Where the spirit of art unites us. - The Fort Smith Regional Art Museum (known as RAM) is an art museum with exhibits, art classes, and a studio art school for children and adults. It serves as a regional center for art education and appreciation in the greater Fort Smith (Sebastian County) area.

When RAM visitors are surprised to learn the museum is free, they’ll see your business name and understand why. Supporting your region’s 77-year-old nonprofit art museum that meets national museum standards and is accessible to all is an honorable investment. Plus, you or six of your employees reap RAM Membership Benefits that help you enjoy this museum to the fullest.

_**This $1,000 tax-deductible donation makes a positive

[Sign Up Here!](https://fsram.org/corporate-member-checkout/)

# WELCOME

**Local, regional, and national art exhibitions. Mid-century modern architecture. Sculpture garden and murals.**

**Yes, General admission is always _FREE._**

[Plan your Visit](https://fsram.org/visit/)

# **CURRENT EXHIBITIONS**

### **JAN 16 – MAY 10**

Join us on **Friday, January 16, from 5 – 7 pm** , for Fort Smith Legend, John Bell, Jr., an exhibition that will highlight original artwork by John Bell, Jr. part of the John Bell, Jr. Legacy Project at RAM.

John Bell, Jr. (1937-2013) was a renowned painter and sculptor who created art for nearly 50 years despite living with cerebral palsy, which limited his mobility and hand use. He advocated for accessibility awareness while developing his unique style influenced by artists like Renoir and Jacques-Louis David. His work often reflected the history and beauty of Fort Smith and the character of its people.
